abstract.p: Steve Sloane adds further information to his May 26 letter about need for air conditioners on Long Island

block.p: As published on May 26, my letter to the editor described the higher humidity and pollen counts that make air-conditioners more important to comfortable living on Long Island than in many other locales. But when my letter was cut off I was just warming up to my main point, which was that you do not have to suffer to be ecological.
Photovoltaic electricity neither burns fuel nor pollutes. It spares our imperiled ozone layer and does not contribute to the greenhouse effect.

As published on May 26, my letter to the editor described the higher humidity and pollen counts that make air-conditioners more important to comfortable living on Long Island than in many other locales. But when my letter was cut off I was just warming up to my main point, which was that you do not have to suffer to be ecological.
Photovoltaic electricity neither burns fuel nor pollutes. It spares our imperiled ozone layer and does not contribute to the greenhouse effect.

While I enjoy my air-conditioned comfort, six solar panels heat my pool. Additionally, 3,800 watts of photovoltaic electric panels are contracted and approved by the Long Island Power Authority to be installed on my home this summer so that my energy consumption is fuel-efficient and guilt-free during peak-load hours.
